techniques.name: Arpeggiated Single-Note Patterns
techniques.description: The iconic intro riff using single notes to outline chord progressions

notes: Single notes played in sequence to create chord outlines
Requires precise alternate picking technique
High register playing on 12th-15th frets
tips: Start slowly and focus on clean single-note execution
Use strict alternate picking for consistency
Practice chord shapes to understand the harmonic structure

techniques.name: Power Chord Transitions
techniques.description: Dynamic shifts from arpeggiated patterns to power chord sections

details.progression: G - D - Em - C - G - D - C - D
notes: Clean transitions between single notes and power chords
Palm muting for tighter rhythm sections
Open chord variations mixed with power chords
tips: Practice switching between picking styles smoothly
Use palm muting to control the power chord sections
Focus on timing during dynamic changes

techniques.name: Lead Guitar Techniques
techniques.description: Advanced lead techniques including bends, vibrato, and legato playing

notes: D major scale and D major pentatonic patterns
String bending with precise pitch control
Wide vibrato and sustain techniques
Legato runs and hammer-on/pull-off combinations
tips: Master basic D major pentatonic scale first
Develop finger strength for wide vibrato
Use light guitar strings for easier bending

sections.name: Intro
sections.description: Iconic arpeggiated intro riff outlining Db-Cb-Gb chord progression in Eb tuning
notes: Single notes played at 12th-15th frets on high E and B strings
Creates harmonic outline of chord progression
Requires precise alternate picking and timing

sections.name: Verse 1
sections.description: Continues arpeggiated pattern under vocals with subtle variations
notes: Maintains intro pattern with slight melodic variations
Supports vocal melody without overwhelming
Clean tone with light reverb

sections.name: Chorus
sections.description: Dynamic shift to power chords and open chord strumming
sections.progression: G - D - Em - C - G - D - C - D
notes: Full power chord and open chord strumming
Increased dynamics and energy
Classic rock chord progression

sections.name: Guitar Solo
sections.description: Extended guitar solo featuring advanced lead techniques
notes: Uses D major and D major pentatonic scales
Features signature Slash-style bending and vibrato
High register melodic phrases with emotional expression

sections.name: Outro
sections.description: Final chorus repetition with gradual fade
sections.progression: G - D - Em - C - G - D - C - D
notes: Maintains full arrangement energy
Vocal ad-libs over chord progression
Fade-out ending

guitar.pickup: Humbucker pickups, bridge position for lead, neck for rhythm

effects.distortion: High-gain amp distortion, possible overdrive boost
effects.reverb: Hall reverb, medium decay for ambience
effects.other: Light delay (200-300ms) for solo sections, possible wah pedal

commonMistakes: Rushing the intro riff - maintain steady timing
Inconsistent alternate picking - develop strict down-up pattern
Over-bending strings in solo - practice pitch accuracy
Neglecting dynamics - contrast between sections is crucial
practiceRoutine: Start with chord progression at slow tempo
Practice intro riff with metronome at 80 BPM
Work on clean alternate picking technique
Combine all elements gradually increasing to 125 BPM
metronomeWork: Intro riff: Start at 80 BPM, build to 125 BPM
Power chord sections: Practice at 100 BPM first
Solo sections: Work individual phrases at 90 BPM
Full song integration at performance tempo
